title: Introducing: MONEY
content:
Every now and then I hear a piece of music that completely knocks me off my feet, and leaves me wondering quite how I hadn’t heard of the artist before.

This is certainly the case with MONEY, whom I can find little information on at all, aside from the fact they’re from Manchester and have also recorded under the monikers Meke Menete, Youth and Books, respectively. After even more digging I also discovered that MONEY are managed by Max Moran, who looks after Egyptian Hip Hop and Vondelpark. Those tit-bits were only found by trawling their Tumblr which features niche videos and quotes, and a handful of Youtube videos. The most recent of said videos, was uploaded last Friday, for the majestic track The Sea. Composed almost entirely of a sombre piano and strained vocals, it’s a truly beautiful track, coming in somewhere between WU LYF and Arcade Fire. The video is comprised of grainy, black and white war footage, elegantly mirroring the atmosphere of The Sea. Check out the track and video below.

‘Each tear: a row of stars,
Each pain: a sun.
A Sun that tightens air
And a light that knows not light itself,
That knows but mass,
And by total force
Does eat up the heavens
To fill its maddening sight.
A dainty sum!
Made of mind-sacks that never die,
Of Suns that are always weeping.’
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
